Articles.Content:
So to me, the KAL-1000 controller seems particularly limited and buggy currently, furthermore it has only the most rudimentary forms of automation (Loop modes). What I propose is that we implement various instrumentation parts, (i.e altimeter, airspeed gauge etc...) which would be able to be connected with the KAL-1000 controller. allowing the inputs to correlate to other actions such as pitch/yaw/roll or throttle/rotor deploy angle. This would allow craft such as rovers, aircraft and boats to be automated.

I would suggest the following parts;

  1. Airspeed gauge
  2. Radar Altimeter
  3. GPS
  4. Transponder
  5. Forward looking Radar

Now the first two are fairly self explanatory in terms of implementation -" keep x airspeed"," stay at x altitude".GPS is fairly obvious however in practice it would require a comsat array around the body you are on. The Transponder is no where near essential however it would allow you to mess with "stay x distance from x vessel" and the such like. Now the one that i would see as being the most tedious thing to implement would be the Radar. This would entail having the terrain in front of the vessel being 'seen' by the radar and give an indication of whether you are on a collision course with the ground or not.

Any suggestions / fleshing out of this idea would be much appreciated
